## CRISPR‑based strategies for combating cellular senescence

Recent advances demonstrate that CRISPR‑based interventions can rejuvenate aged cells and extend organismal lifespan. Lee et al. (2022) edited the *Tert* locus in aged hematopoietic stem cells, restoring telomere length and regenerative function. Nguyen and Zhao (2021) repressed *p16^INK4a* with dCas9‑KRAB, markedly reducing senescence markers in fibroblasts. Silva and O'Connor (2023) activated telomerase via CRISPR‑a, achieving a 15 % increase in median mouse lifespan. Together, these studies suggest that precise genome and epigenome editing hold promise for anti‑aging therapeutics.
